data.event: Head of controversial Palestinian orchestra banned from West Bank camp . The head of a Palestinian youth orchestra who set off an uproar by performing a concert for Holocaust survivors in Israel was blocked Tuesday from entering a West Bank refugee camp because of concerns for her safety, a local official said.
"When Younis tried to enter the camp on Tuesday, she was halted by a prominent local leader," Asiba said.
Younis was not available for comment on Tuesday but earlier said she only meant to spread goodwill through the concert.

On Sunday, camp officials boarded up Younis' rehearsal studio and confiscated the orchestra's music instruments: an electronic keyboard, a few kamanjas - an Arab instrument that looks like a violin - and some small drums.

event.title: established the Strings of Freedom orchestra around three years ago

data.event: Younis established the Strings of Freedom orchestra around three years ago in the Jenin refugee camp.
